QxtCsvModel Class Reference
[QxtCore module]

Provides a QAbstractTableModel for CSV Files. More... 

 #include <QxtCsvModel>

Inherits QAbstractTableModel.

Detailed Description

Member Documentation

QxtCsvModel ( QObject * parent = 0 )

default Constructor




explicit QxtCsvModel ( QIODevice * file , QObject * parent = 0 , bool withHeader = false , QChar separator = ',' )

constructs a QxtCsvModel from a QIODevice as source
withHeader specifies if the data on the device contains a header or not. separator is the separator to use for the columns. most widely used separators are ',' '\t' ';'




explicit QxtCsvModel ( const QString filename , QObject * parent = 0 , bool withHeader = false , QChar separator = ',' )

constructs a QxtCsvModel from a filename as source
withHeader specifies if the data in the file contains a header or not. separator is the separator to use for the columns. most widely used separators are ',' '\t' ';'

void setSource ( QIODevice * file , bool withHeader = false , QChar separator = ',' )

reads the cvs data from filewithHeader specifies if the data on the device contains a header or not. separator is the separator to use for the columns. most widely used separators are ',' '\t' ';'




void setSource ( const QString filename , bool withHeader = false , QChar separator = ',' )

reads the cvs data from filenamewithHeader specifies if the data in the file contains a header or not. separator is the separator to use for the columns. most widely used separators are ',' '\t' ';'




void toCSV ( QIODevice * file , bool withHeader = false , QChar separator = ',' )

writes the cvs data to filewithHeader specifies if to write the header or not separator is the separator to use for the columns. most widely used separators are ',' '\t' ';'




void toCSV ( const QString filename , bool withHeader = false , QChar separator = ',' )

writes the cvs data to filenamewithHeader specifies if to write the header or not separator is the separator to use for the columns. most widely used separators are ',' '\t' ';'
